task_summary: Detect the maroon square block, approach and align, push it to translate along the table surface, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator must move a maroon square/rectangular block resting on a tabletop by executing a controlled push. The sequence begins with perception to localize the target, followed by a safe approach above the object and fine alignment near its side. The end-effector then performs a planar push to translate the block laterally to a new location visible in later frames. After motion, the robot retreats to a safe height and pauses briefly. The operation assumes clear line of sight and no need to grasp the block.
preconditions: Robot initialized with free workspace above table
Maroon square block visible on tabletop
No obstacles in intended push direction
stepwise_plan: Detect or scan for the maroon_square
ApproachAndAlign with tight tolerance near object side
Push the block a set distance in the intended direction
Retreat to a safe distance and wait
success_criteria: Block position noticeably changed from its initial pose
No collisions with neighboring objects during push
Robot returns to a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: If detect fails, retry and then scan in a spiral pattern
If alignment is off, re-run ApproachAndAlign due to sequence structure
If push stalls, task can be re-invoked or distance reduced in a new run
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after completing the retreat and wait following a successful push.

frame_5.now_evidence: Clear contact and onset of lateral motion on the maroon block during push.
frame_5.predicts_next: Continued translation of the block along the same direction.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector aligned near the block, indicating imminent actuation.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation expected and direction is consistent with later frames.

node_specs.description: Attempt to detect the maroon square block; wrapped with retry.
Active scan fallback if immediate detection fails.
Move to a safe pre-push height above the target.
Close in and align along the push direction near the object's side.
Planar push to translate the block laterally across the tabletop.
Back off from contact to a safe distance.
Short pause to ensure motion settles and sensing can update.

failure_modes: Target not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Misalignment causes slip or bump into neighbors
Push distance insufficient to show movement
recovery_strategy: Re-run task with increased distance if safe
Abort and retreat on contact anomalies (external supervisor)
assumptions: 'maroon square' refers to the pink/maroon rectangular block on the right of the table
Push direction_deg=0 corresponds to rightward translation in the scene
Task is push-based; grasping is unnecessary per frames

expected_success_criteria: Block final pose differs by more than 0.05 m from start
Robot ends with no contact and stable pose
